> Oisin Kim wrote:
>> I've been looking to check that JUnit runs tests serially,
>> i.e. one at a  time, I've been told that there are occasions
>> when JUnit runs tests concurrently, is this so?

Not unless you take drastic and overt action to make it so.

>> I can't see how this would be, as tests which access the DB
>> would almost certainly fail if they were run concurrently.

"Doctor, it hurts when I do this." -- patient
"Don't do that." -- Dr.

It's better when your tests *DON'T* access the database.
Use MockObjects.


--- "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@r...> wrote:
> JUnit never runs tests concurrently. You can, however, build 
> multithreaded test case classes.

See 'junit.extensions.ActiveTestSuite'.  It will run all of your 
TestCases simultaneously, using threads.

It's part of the standard JUnit distribution.
